author: Erika Alexandra Rebolledo Torres
title: Colombia completÃ³ pagos para la COP16 y evita el destino de los Panamericanos
text: Colombia completÃ³ pagos para la COP16 y evita el destino de los Panamericanos La ministra de Medio Ambiente indicÃ³ que tambiÃ©n se avanza en la agenda del evento de biodiversidad. Ante la incertidumbre sobre la posibilidad de que la COP16 corriera la misma suerte que los Juegos Panamericanos, cuya realizaciÃ³n fracasÃ³, la ministra de Medio Ambiente, Susana Muhamad, anunciÃ³ que Colombia ya completÃ³ el pago de todas sus obligaciones financieras para ser sede del evento de biodiversidad mÃ¡s importante del mundo, que se celebrarÃ¡ en octubre en Cali. En cuanto a los preparativos y la agenda, que tambiÃ©n han sido una preocupaciÃ³n de distintos sectores, Muhamad seÃ±alÃ³ que el proceso avanza significativamente, con especial atenciÃ³n en la zona verde y el pabellÃ³n Colombia. Puede leer: â€œSe recibieron al 5 de julio que se cerraron las inscripciones, 1.435 propuestas de eventos de la sociedad civil, del empresariado, de las comunidades de entidades gubernamentales, propuestas de 32 paÃ­ses y una propuesta de 740 iniciativas empresariales para el Ã¡rea de exposiciÃ³nâ€, indicÃ³ la ministra. SubrayÃ³ que todo se estÃ¡ sometiendo a curadurÃ­a y se ha articulado con el Convenio de Diversidad BiolÃ³gica, que todavÃ­a mantiene abierta la propuesta de agenda para la zona azul, la cual se cerrarÃ¡ el 31 de julio. â€œObviamente estamos trabajando contrarreloj, ustedes saben que asumimos una responsabilidad de preparar en siete meses algo que normalmente se prepara en dos aÃ±os. Entonces es una agenda muy intensa, pero los equipos han respondido muy bien y estamos a tiempoâ€, agregÃ³. Por su parte el alcalde de Cali, Alejandro Ã‰der, destacÃ³ el esfuerzo del sector hotelero para recibir a los mÃ¡s de 19.000 visitantes esperados. AdemÃ¡s, destacÃ³ el esfuerzo del Ministerio de Defensa por reforzar la seguridad de la ciudad con 4.000 policÃ­as adicionales que se sumarÃ¡n a los 6.000 ya existentes, asÃ­ como la llegada de 1.600 militares. Entretanto la gobernadora del Valle del Cauca, Dilian Francisca Toro, indicÃ³ que se ha organizado una agenda cultural en colaboraciÃ³n con el Ministerio de Cultura, que incluirÃ¡ actividades en las bibliotecas, Bellas Artes y el Boulevard del Oriente. TambiÃ©n se llevarÃ¡ a cabo un foro de gobernadores de Colombia y otros paÃ­ses para discutir iniciativas regionales en biodiversidad. El Ministerio de Comercio, Industria y Turismo ha asegurado que proporcionarÃ¡ apoyo financiero para la adecuaciÃ³n del Centro de Eventos Valle del PacÃ­fico, que serÃ¡ el principal recinto del evento.

author: Dr. D.K Olukoya
title: Fighting Like The Psalmist
text:
He understood warfare and fought spiritual enemies.
He dealt with Goliath;
He dealt with the Philistines;
He subjected all his enemies to shame;
He never lost battles;
He was the one who eventually captured Jerusalem when the people there were boasting that even if the lame and blind guide the city, it cannot be taken.
He entered through their waterways and captured the city. It is therefore spiritually beneficial to learn from his prayers to pick lessons.
It is time for you to begin to pray the aggressive prayer of the psalmist.
When situations get to a level and they are mocking you, they are telling you to forsake Christ, they are telling you that you are useless, your mockers are more than your helpers, and it is calling for the aggressive prayer of the psalmist.
The coven that can withstand the aggressive prayer of the psalmist has not yet been created.
I remember that our father in the Lord who has gone to be with the Lord now. He died at age 107.
I went with him somewhere. They served us jollof-rice and fish. He said, Let us pray on the food, and we bowed our heads.
He read the first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, and twelfth psalms, and he was reading them in Yoruba on the food.
The food ran cold. Eventually, he finished the prayer. I could not eat. I was full of questions.
I asked,_ Daddy, why did you have to read so many psalms before we could eat?â€
He looked at me and said in Yoruba, you are a kid.â€
He said that he came from a highly polygamous homes with plenty of wives. He said all the wives, including his own mother, were witches.
And those were the people cooking their food. He was eating that food until he started primary 1 at the age of 17.
He said, â€œYoung man, I will be praying n my food. That is the food that brought me to this level.
He knew the weapons. If not, his life would have been worse. Eventually, he went through school and became a man of God.
This is a very serious matter.
But the Christians of today are very lazy.
The great Apostle Babalola memorised all the psalms in his head, and that is where he used to take weapons from.
We are going to stop here today. We will continue this topic next time.
PRAYER POINTS.
1. Serpents and scorpions biting my destiny, die in the name of Jesus;
2. Thunder of God arises; destroy the enemies of my next level, in the name of Jesus;
3. Stubborn pursuers hear the word of the Lord, pursue yourselves in the name of Jesus.
God bless you and your family, in Jesus name, amen.

author: admin
title: Collaboration Protocol Signed to Support Health of Nursing Professionals: Learning from PAIME Success - Breaking Latest News
text:
The General Council of Physicians and the General Nursing Council have announced a new collaboration to implement a Comprehensive Care Program for Nursing Professionals. This program, inspired by the successful Comprehensive Care Program for the Sick Doctor (PAIME), aims to promote the health and well-being of nurses.
The main objective of this protocol is to provide nursing professionals with the support they need in terms of health promotion, prevention, and care. The program will offer voluntary access and rehabilitation for nurses facing health issues, such as mental health or addiction problems. It will also ensure that healthcare workers undergoing treatment receive the necessary care with confidentiality and professional secrecy.
The presidents of the General Councils of Medicine and Nursing, TomÃ¡s Cobo Castro and Florentino PÃ©rez Raya, praised the initiative, highlighting the importance of ensuring that healthcare professionals are able to provide the best possible care to their patients.
TomÃ¡s Cobo emphasized the significance of sharing their experience with other health professions, while Florentino PÃ©rez Raya stressed the importance of supporting nurses who may be struggling with mental health issues and care overload. The program represents a significant improvement in the healthcare systemâ€™s ability to care for those who care for others.
This collaboration between the General Council of Physicians and the General Nursing Council signifies a positive step towards ensuring that nurses receive the support they need to carry out their vital work effectively.

organizations.name: general councils of medicine and nursing

author: Anonym
title: 12 hours after his arrest.. France deports a Tunisian imam for speaking about flags - Teller Report
text: Mahjoub Mahjoubi was quickly deported from France based on the new immigration law (social networking sites) Yesterday, Thursday, France deported Tunisian imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi, who works in a mosque in the south of the country, on charges of â€œextremism, promoting hatred in his sermons, and making unacceptable statements,â€ less than 12 hours after his arrest. For several days, Mahjoubi has been subjected to criticism by French Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin, who last Sunday requested the withdrawal of his residence permit. He also asked the governor to inform the judiciary of the statements made by the imam of the mosque in the city of Banyuls-sur-Seize, bringing the matter to an announcement by the public prosecutor in the city of Nimes. It opened a preliminary investigation into the case. Mahjoubi was arrested in front of his family yesterday afternoon based on the deportation decision, according to his lawyer, Samir Hamroun, and was transferred to an administrative detention center in the Paris region. Mahjoubi has lived in France since the mid-eighties, and is married with four children. Darmanin announced - on the X platform - that â€œless than 12 hours after his arrest,â€ the French authorities deported him to Tunisia, adding that due to the recently passed immigration law, what he described as the â€œrapid expulsionâ€ of the imam was possible. ðŸ”´France ðŸ”»The Minister of the Interior of #France today orders the expulsion of the Tunisian Imam Mahjoub Mahjoubi. Imam of the city of Pagnol-sur-Seiz. This was only hours after it was reported by a far-right parliamentarian. ðŸ”»The charge is hatred for France ðŸ”»The crime tool. Watch the clip ðŸ‘‡#Boycott_French_products1210@drassagheer pic.twitter.com/Vxo7Txcvpv - Redouan-Radwan (@Redouan224) February 19, 2024 Statements about notables Actions were taken against Mahjoubi against the backdrop of a video clip in which he appeared describing the â€œtricolor flagâ€ as â€œa satanic flag that has no value in the sight of God,â€ in what Darmanin interpreted as a talk about the French flag. However, Mahjoubi confirmed that he was not talking about the French flag, and that he was referring to the multiple flags that were raised in the African Cup of Nations and divided Muslims, and he said, â€œI am not Voltaire or Victor Hugo, so instead of saying all these multi-colored or different flags, I said all "These flags are tricolor, but I wasn't talking about France." His lawyer echoed this justification, stressing that he was talking about flags in the plural, criticizing nationalism, and promising that no one would believe his client. Because "he has a beard and an accent." For his part, the governor said that the imam has been under surveillance for several months, and the deportation decision was not based on statements from the media alone; Rather, it is linked to others related to the status of women and the Jewish people, as he put it. Deportation of foreign imams Mahjoubi is not the first imam to be deported by France. Abdel Rahim Sayah was previously deported on charges of promoting terrorist acts, and Sayah is an Algerian who was an official in a mosque in France that was closed in 2018. The authorities consider him a â€œSalafist leaderâ€ and he was deported to Algeria last June. At the beginning of 2020, French President Emmanuel Macron announced his intention to end the duties of about 300 imams sent by various countries, while at the same time increasing the number of imams trained in France. Since January 1, France has no longer accepted the appointment of new foreign imams sent by other countries. Source: Agencies

author: Patricia Martellotti
title: Santa Barbara Zoo to Open New Tropical Wonders Exhibit Featuring 12-foot Burmese Python
text:
Santa Barbara Zoo to Open New Tropical Wonders Exhibit Featuring 12-foot Burmese Python
SANTA BARBARA, Calif. - Itâ€™s heating up at the Santa Barbara Zoo.
But not because of the weather.
A brand-new exhibit called Tropical Wonders is about to open, bringing guests face-to-face with some of the worldâ€™s most exotic species, including one very slithery superstar.
The new Tropical Wonders exhibit transports visitors into a lush rainforest environment.
It's home to vibrant birds, colorful frogs, and one seriously impressive resident: a 12-foot Burmese python.
Zoo staff say the exhibit is designed to educate the public on biodiversity and the importance of rainforest conservation.
But itâ€™s the python thatâ€™s stealing the spotlight, and he's projected to fascinate guests with its size, strength, and slow, mesmerizing movements.
Tropical Wonders will be open to the public on Friday, and zoo officials say itâ€™s just the beginning of even more immersive wildlife experiences to come.

author: VNExplorer
title: Don't rain on our parade! Hardy Brits brave miserable weather as they hit the town for New Year's Eve parties and firework displays
text:
Hardy Brits have braved the lashing rain and strong winds to head out for a night on the town to welcome the new year in style.
Revellers, some dressed to the nines in their finest outfits, were seen on the streets of Newcastle and Liverpool powering through the pouring rain in a bid to make the most of New Yearâ€™s Eve celebrations.
Others dressed little bit more suitably for the weather have flocked into city and town centres across the country to marvel at spectacular light and firework displays.
Thatâ€™s despite a forecasters putting a storm warning in place which has caused some events in the south to be cancelled due to powerful 75mph gales.
In true British fashion, large parts of the country are set to welcome 2024 in with a deluge of rain, but many who are out and about to celebrate the occasion will do their best not to let it dampen their spirits.
NEWCASTLE: A reveller covers her head from the rain with a piece of fabric as she heads out into town
NEWCASTLE: A woman holds her coat aloft in a bid to keep dry ahead of New Year celebrations
NEWCASTLE: Hardy revellers take cover under umbrellas, coats and even handbags to stay safe from the elements
BLACKPOOL: Fireworks erupt over the water as a light show illuminates the Blackpool Tower
EDINBURGH: Sisters Sophie (left) and Scarlett Strang (right) smile during Hogmanay celebrations
EDINBURGH: University students from Japan pose with placards that spell out â€˜2024â€™ in front of Edinburgh Castle
There are due to be dramatic displays across Britain, with the iconic London fireworks set to soar as high as 200m into the air when they are launched from the London Eye on the stroke of midnight.
The Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, said tickets for the event were sold out, adding: â€˜If you didnâ€™t manage to get tickets to attend, the capital is packed with plenty more exciting New Yearâ€™s Eve events.â€™
In Scotland, the 30th Hogmanay street party in Edinburgh will be headlined by rock band Pulp after their surprise reunion last year.
Edinburgh City Council leader Cammy Day said: â€˜After the difficult years of the pandemic, Iâ€™m overjoyed that our festivals are back to their brilliant best and providing such high calibre cultural offerings for our residents and visitors.â€™
Elsewhere, there has already been an impressive firework show in Blackpool, as the explosives erupted into the sky with Blackpool Tower illuminated in the background.
In Newcastleâ€™s Quayside crowds were treated to BAFTA award-winning artist Seb Lee-Delisleâ€™s new Laser Light City laser show, which was projected onto the Baltic Flour Mills.
However, not every planned event will take place this evening, with Plymouthâ€™s Winter Wonderland and a Devon townâ€™s fireworks display both cancelled.
A yellow weather warning for wind is in place for Britainâ€™s entire southern coastline and south Wales.
NEWCASTLE: Revellers brave the rain as they head for a night on the town in Newcastle
NEWCASTLE: A pair of well-prepared revellers hold their umbrellas aloft as they walk through Newcastle city centre
LEEDS: Two girls give a male reveller a peck on the cheek ahead of the last night out of the year
LEEDS: A pair of ladies pose for the camera in Leeds city centre on New Yearâ€™s Eve
LEEDS: A group of ladies take cover from the rain in Leeds under an umbrella as they head out to celebrate New Year
BLACKPOOL: Spectacular fireworks erupt over the water next to Blackpool Tower as the iconic venue lights up for New Years
LIVERPOOL: Revellers smile as they dart through the rain in a bid to reach the clubs and bars in Liverpool city centre
LIVERPOOL: A pair of ladies cover their heads with jackets in a bid to stay dry this evening
EDINBURGH: Brandon Fernandes and partner Tylo Verreynne embrace as they celebrate Hogmanay
NEWCASTLE: A spectacular light show takes place at the Baltic Flour Mills in Newcastleâ€™s Quayside
NEWCASTLE: Crowds gather in front of the Baltic Flour Mills in Newcastleâ€™s Quayside
LONDON: Rain falls over the Houses of Parliament ahead of the New Yearâ€™s Eve fireworks
NEWCASTLE: Revellers brave the rain and cold weather to enjoy the New Years Eve celebrations
EDINBURGH: Visitors from Spain dress up in Santa hats ahead of Hogmanay New Year celebrations
EDINBURGH: Partygoers get ready for a fun night ahead during the Hogmanay Street party celebrations
EDINBURGH: A man and woman pose for the cameras after picking up some food during the Hogmanay New Year celebration
EDINBURGH: Tourists from Brazil dress up in kilts for the Hogmanay New Year celebrations
While the north west has been slapped with a rain warning with heavy downpours expected across Lancashire, Merseyside, Greater Manchester, Blackpool, Blackburn, and West Yorkshire.
Saturdayâ€™s Eurostar cancellations hti one family who were hoping to make it back to Britain in time for New Years, after they were stranded in Brussels following a surprise trip for a Canadian relative.
Luke Gibbs, 32, from Kenley, south London, travelled with his wife, Kyla, cousin Liam Eton and sister-in-law Brea Melanson, from Canada, and planned to arrive in London in time for New Yearâ€™s Eve celebrations on Sunday.
Mr Gibbs, a business development manager, paid Â£600 for a New Yearâ€™s Eve event in London Bridge, which is not refundable and now he cannot attend after his train from Brussels to St Pancras was cancelled. He described the communication with Eurostar as â€˜appallingâ€™.
â€˜I think the way (Eurostar) dealt with it is pretty appalling in terms of not trying to say â€˜this is how you rebook it, weâ€™ll help you out with expensesâ€™,â€™ Mr Gibbs told the PA news agency.
â€˜They just said, â€˜unfortunately, itâ€™s cancelled, weâ€™re sorry, get on with itâ€™, which is shocking really.â€™
Organisers of Plymouthâ€™s Winter Wonderland took the â€˜very difficult decisionâ€™ to rip up its plans for New Yearâ€™s Eve tonight because of the expected stormy winds.
â€˜As much as we are very disappointed and frustrated, your safety comes first, as well as ours, and we canâ€™t possibly take the risk,â€™ they said as they confirmed those who had bought tickets will be fully refunded.
Elsewhere, Barnstaple, in Devon, cancelled its annual fireworks because of the â€˜horrendousâ€™ weather, reported Devon Live.
Barnstaple Town Centre Management said it axed the display for safety reasons.
They said: â€˜Unfortunately due to the weather conditions and the gusting winds we will be unable to do the fireworks this evening due to safety.
â€˜We know this is disappointing, but safety is always the priority and we unfortunately canâ€™t control the weather.â€™
Temperatures are set to plummet on New Yearâ€™s Day and in January increasing the chance of sleet and snow on higher grounds in the north, with frosty mornings for many.
Weather Outlook forecaster Brian Gaze said: â€˜There are growing signs of cold weather developing as we head through the first half of January.
â€˜The chance of a significant cold spell is quite high.
â€˜The highest risk of snow will probably be in the North and East. But if low pressure pushes up from the southwest, this would lead to the possibility of snow as weather fronts move northeast.â€™

author: Juan Armando de la Rosa
title: Por falta de agua, pobladores de Atasta bloquean la avenida Adolfo Ruiz Cortines en Villahermosa | El Heraldo de MÃ©xico
text: Este jueves por la maÃ±ana, decenas de pobladores de la colonia Atasta en [Villahermosa](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/14/por-calor-cortes-electricos-vecinos-de-villahermosa-toman-las-calles-para-dormir-602731.html), Tabasco, bloquearon uno de los carriles de la avenida Adolfo Ruiz Cortines para protestar por la [falta de agua ](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/13/mapas-inteligentes-una-herramienta-para-enfrentar-el-desabasto-de-agua-en-mexico-601039.html)que llevan padeciendo desde hace dos meses. Los manifestantes, seÃ±alaron que han tenido que comprar pipas de agua debido a que las autoridades no han solucionado el problema del desbasto, por lo cual, estÃ¡ maÃ±ana decidieron cerrar la avenida. Sigue leyendo: [Choque entre autobÃºs y trÃ¡iler deja 8 lesionados en Tabasco](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/6/12/choque-entre-autobus-trailer-deja-lesionados-en-tabasco-611793.html) [FOTOS: Explota una tuberÃ­a de gas en un mercado de Villahermosa](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/7/fotos-explota-una-tuberia-de-gas-en-un-mercado-de-villahermosa-600927.html) Bloquean avenida principal de Tabasco Cabe destacar que la avenida Adolfo Ruiz Cortines, es una de las principales arterias viales de la ciudad de Villahermosa, por lo cual, el bloqueo ocasionÃ³ un severo caos vial en diversas zonas de la capital tabasqueÃ±a. Debido al bloqueo, las autoridades desplegaron un operativo para agilizar el trÃ¡fico, no obstante, el personal del ayuntamiento de Centro se comprometiÃ³ a mandar pipas con agua a la colonia Atasta y finalmente, los inconformes accedieron a retirar el bloqueo. DRV

author: Independent Sentinel
title: Victor Davis Hanson: The Most Amazing Comeback in American Political History
text:
Victor Davis Hanson spoke with Laura Ingraham on Fox News about the response of the media to Donald Trumpâ€™s success in the Iowa caucus. The Democrat Progressives think that if they keep dehumanizing and lying about Donald Trump, they will destroy him. Ingraham asked Hanson about it.
â€œIn the last year or two,â€ Victor Davis Hanson said, â€œthe opposite is true. The more they lie, and they do not apologize, and they do not correct the record, and the more theyâ€™re found out, the less credibility they have and the more popularity Donald Trump had in the primaries.
But Biden has so much energy:
THEY CANâ€™T STOP THEMSELVES
â€œI think thatâ€™s going to extend to the general election because they canâ€™t stop,â€ Hanson continued. â€œThey have a Trump fix. Theyâ€™re like an addict, and they know itâ€™s not helping them, but they canâ€™t stop it because theyâ€™re addicted to it.
â€œSo theyâ€™re going to continue what you saw last night all through the next year, and I think what little credibility they have left will be shot, and itâ€™s going to help Donald Trump. You know, I think we forget that without these media people, the whole January 6 armed insurrection or most of the lies about the origins of COVID and social distancing and masking or the circumstances of George Floydâ€™s death and the rioting that happened, not to mention disinformation on the laptop or Russian collusion, all of that wouldnâ€™t have had any resonance â€¦ it didnâ€™t destroy Donald Trump.
â€œHeâ€™s got the most amazing political comeback in American political history, and I think thatâ€™s because of the news mediaâ€™s bias.
Laura Ingraham said, â€œI donâ€™t know who they think is voting. I mean these are real Americans who are really supporting Trump. So I guess it just confirms what everyone thinks â€“ that these people literally hate, despise the caucus voters in Iowa, they despise them because theyâ€™re racist, theyâ€™re too white, theyâ€™re this or that, they hate them.
-
The Importance of Prayer: How a Christian Gold Company Stands Out by Defending Americansâ€™ Retirement
DEMOCRATS HATE YOU
Hanson replied, â€œThey do. We drowned them out for a long time. I mean, look at the vocabulary theyâ€™ve used: clingers from Obama, and then chumps and dregs from Biden, deplorables, irredeemable, and lately, people like Chris Matthews have been warning us about the dangerous rural people.
â€œSo theyâ€™ve always despised them. â€¦ now they have a new narrative that Trump is a dictator. Heâ€™s going to have revenge retribution that shows that theyâ€™re really scared that nobodyâ€™s listening to their lies anymore, and theyâ€™re afraid that itâ€™s counterproductive, and now all they can say is Trump might get elected, and he might do this and this. He might do what we would do if we were in his position and had suffered from us. So itâ€™s a projection; it reflects weakness, not strength.
â€œI donâ€™t think they have much credibility, and theyâ€™re losing the independents, losing minority voters â€¦â€
Hopefully, Democrat Progressives will keep acting like loons, showing everyone who they are. All the hate comes from them all of it.
The Democrat Progressives think that if they keep dehumanizing and lying about Donald Trump, they will destroy him.

author: Emmanuel Nana Nsiah
title: The Indwelling Christ Is The Essence Of Resurrection Power â€“ Pastor Adubofourh Asiedu
text: The Yennyawoso District Minister of The Church of Pentecost, Pastor Maxwell Adubofourh Asiedu, has stated that the resurrection power is not just an abstract concept, but a living presence within believers, personified in Christ Jesus. In a message shared with the congregation at the ongoing New Tafo Zone Easter Convention at the New Tafo M/A Division School Park on Thursday, March 28, 2024, Pastor Adubofourh Asiedu spoke on the topic: â€œExperiencing the Pentecostal Power Through the Death and Resurrection of Jesus Christ.â€ The convention is being held under the theme: â€œJesus Christ, The Resurrection and Life,â€ â€“ John 11:25. Focusing on John 11:25, Romans 8:11 and Acts 2:36 as his main biblical references, the Yennyawoso District Minister highlighted the significance of Jesusâ€™ death and resurrection, emphasising the immense power that believers inherit through their faith in Him. He encouraged the congregants to recognise and utilize this power, reminding them that they have the ability to bring life to dead situations through their faith in Christ. â€œWhen you speak life into a dead situation it must live again because of the resurrection power that is in you,â€ he said. Drawing from Ephesians 1:17-20 and Philippians 3:9-10, the clergyman noted that the resurrection power is an active manifestation of the move of the Holy Spirit. He explained that Christians have access to this power through their belief in Christ Jesus (Romans 8:16-17), their unity with God (John 10:30), and their role as good servants of God (Matthew 25:14ff). He stressed the importance of obedience, fulfilling the Great Commission, and maintaining a humble and servile attitude to nurture and activate the resurrection power within them, cautioning against self-gratification and self-glorification, as these could hinder the operation of the resurrection power. Emphasising the enduring and transformative nature of the resurrection power, Pastor Adubofourh Asiedu called on non-believers to come to Jesus and experience this power for themselves. The event concluded with a prayer, during which 10 individuals received the baptism of the Holy Spirit, and several others received spiritual gifts. [News Ghana](https://newsghana.com.gh)on [Google News](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAiENOAw7LsGXCOM4baC2AVg8cqFAgKIhDTgMOy7BlwjjOG2gtgFYPH?hl=en-GH&gl=GH&ceid=GH%3Aen)

organizations.name: new tafo m/a division school park

author: Jessica White
title: John Legend Shared a Smooth Piano Version of "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas"
text:
Create a free profile to get unlimited access to exclusive show news, updates, and more!
John Legend Shared a Smooth Piano Version of "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas"
The Voice Coach cemented his place as king of the yuletide season with this new video.
Ever the bringer of joy, [John Legend](https://www.nbc.com/nbc-insider/people/john-legend) has delighted his fans just in time for the holidays with a soulful rendition of "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas."
The [ ](https://www.nbc.com/nbc-insider/the-voice-season-27-premiere-date-coaches-details)[ Coach has delivered many a merry holiday tune throughout his years, and shared fresh cheer with fans in a December 25 ](https://www.nbc.com/the-voice/episodes)[Instagram video](https://www.instagram.com/johnlegend/).
The EGOT winner tapped his velvety vocals and timeless verve to bring the carol to new heights with his signature touch. Legend is no stranger to a holiday bop â€” his seventh studio album, A Legendary Christmas, continues to be the gift that keeps giving, boasting several bops that'd make holiday lovers rock around the Christmas tree.
While "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas" appears on the album, Legend gave fans a stripped-down version in honor of the holidays for a certified holiday treat.
RELATED: [John Legend's Superb Version of "This Christmas" Is a Must-Hear Holiday Gift](https://www.nbc.com/nbc-insider/john-legend-this-christmas-cover)
"A little something for you and yours," Legend captioned the post.
Watch John Legend's angelic new "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas" version
Legend shared the performance on Christmas Day, with the clip finding him seated at his piano, looking downright dashing in a mint green suit jacket perfect for the holiday. The singer instantly set the tone for a heartfelt performance, capturing viewers' attention with his very first keystroke.
Boasting a timeless sound and velvety timbre, Legend's vocals were practically made for the holidays, so he carried the tune with ease. Legend masterfully blends emotional delivery with his crystal-clean precision to deliver a rendition that is both nostalgic and uniquely his own.
Originally recorded by the late Judy Garland for the 1944 film Meet Me in St. Louis, "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas" has become a holiday playlist staple, offering hope and comfort to everyone who celebrates. Legend's interpretation honors the song's reverent legacy while adding his distinctive style, marking yet another iconic performance from The Voice Coach.
RELATED: [The Super Hollywood (and Romantic!) Way John Legend & Chrissy Teigen Met 17 Years Ago](https://www.nbc.com/nbc-insider/john-legend-and-chrissy-teigens-entire-relationship-timeline)
In addition to sharing his musical prowess with the world, Legend also shared a photo on [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DD_665OIixW/?img_index=1) that appeared to be taken on Christmas morning of himself with his wife, Chrissy Teigen, and their four kids. Legend has clearly spent the holidays soaking up quality time â€” in the picture, Legend and Teigen beam ear to ear while sitting beneath the tree with [Luna, Miles, Esti, and Wren](https://www.nbc.com/nbc-insider/who-are-john-legend-chrissy-teigen-kids-luna-miles-esti), who all donned matching plaid pajamas for the festivities.
The holiday hitmaker and his loved ones seem to be having a blast this season.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->online media outlet
